Data Manipulation Module¶

competition.create_df_from_dicts(data_list: List[Tuple[str, str, float]], dicts: List[Dict[str | float, str | float]], dict_labels: List[str]) → DataFrame¶

Create a pandas DataFrame from dictionaries.

Parameters:

  • data_list (list) – List of data.

  • dicts (list) – List of dictionaries to add to the DataFrame.

  • dict_labels (list) – List of column names corresponding to the dictionaries.

Returns:

Pandas DataFrame constructed from the input.

Return type:

DataFrame

competition.get_X_and_y_from_df(df: DataFrame) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]¶

Extract features and labels from a DataFrame.

Parameters:

df (DataFrame) – Input pandas DataFrame.

Returns:

Features array (X) and labels array (y).

Return type:

tuple

competition.get_dicts_from_rdd(rdd: RDD, key_idx: int, value_idx: int) → Dict[str | float, str | float]¶

Convert RDD into a dictionary based on specified columns.

Parameters:

  • rdd (RDD) – Input RDD.

  • key_idx (int) – Index for the dictionary key.

  • value_idx (int) – Index for the dictionary value.

Returns:

Dictionary constructed from the RDD.

Return type:

dict

competition.initialize_spark() → SparkContext¶

Initialize and configure a Spark context.

Returns:

The configured Spark context.

Return type:

SparkContext

competition.parse_json_file(path: str, schema: List[str]) → RDD¶

Parse a JSON file into an RDD based on the provided schema.

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path to the JSON file.

  • schema (list) – List of fields to extract from the JSON.

Returns:

RDD containing tuples of the extracted data.

Return type:

RDD

competition.preprocess_data(X: ndarray) → Tuple[ndarray, StandardScaler]¶

Preprocess data using standard scaling.

Parameters:

X (array) – Features array.

Returns:

Scaled features array and the scaler object.

Return type:

tuple

competition.read_rdd_from_csv(path: str, header: bool = True) → RDD¶

Read an RDD from a CSV file and optionally skip header.

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path to the CSV file.

  • header (bool) – If True, skips the header row.

Returns:

The resulting RDD after reading the file.

Return type:

RDD
